page.title: 15COMMUNICATIONS IN SWINDERBY.
page.content: {POSTAL.}The Post Office used to be on the site of Mrs. Macs shop. In 1940 the present property was converted to a house and sub post office. The{mail}arrives each day at 6.30am. and is sorted by 4 people. It is then delivered in the village by 3 people, who have their own area and walk or use a moped. A van delivers large parcels later. The mail is collected at 10.30am. and 4.30pm. and taken by the{Royal Mail Van}to Lincoln. In 1985 the{houses} in the village were all re-numbered to make delivery easier. Every house has a postcode which speeds sorting at the GPO. eg. LN69LV, LN6 = Lincoln area 6, 9 = Swinderby, LV = Station Road. {ORAL.}There is one public telephone box in the High Street. All parts of the UK and most of the World can be called by dialing the STD. code.
